title: Victorian Font
content:
Hello, Does anyone know a font similar to the one Barnum & Bailey is set in? I realize this is tilted, but there must be a roman around...Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131130062403im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CIRCUS_5168.jpg)
author: talgoretsky

comments.content: I would guess this was hand lettered. Compare the cap S's. Something that could fill the bill as a starting point would be Albertus Black or Flange Medium Italic. You would still have to oblique it and try to condense to match. Or just hire a guy with a big red nose to redraw it.

Agree with previous comment, definitely hand-lettered.  
Some I like for this kind of job: [Highway](http://web.archive.org/web/20131130062403/http:/youngjerks.com/Highway-Typeface) by Dan Cassaro, [Hensler 2](http://web.archive.org/web/20131130062403/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/hensler2.php), [Chipping](http://web.archive.org/web/20131130062403/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/chipping/), [Mexborough](http://web.archive.org/web/20131130062403/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/mexborough/), [Chipperly](http://web.archive.org/web/20131130062403/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/chipperly/), [Liberty](http://web.archive.org/web/20131130062403/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/liberty/), [Symbol](http://web.archive.org/web/20131130062403/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/symbol/), [Agora](http://web.archive.org/web/20131130062403/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/agora-bq/)

Highway by Dan Cassaro no longer at his website.

View at [http://designenvy.aiga.org/highway-typeface-dan-cassaro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131130062403/http:/designenvy.aiga.org/highway-typeface-dan-cassaro/ "http://designenvy.aiga.org/highway-typeface-dan-cassaro/")

Agree with previous comments, that this is definitely a hand lettered sample. For something similar, another good alternative might be [Doncaster](http://web.archive.org/web/20131130062403/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/doncaster/).
